name: Mercure Grand Hotel Doha

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the rooms were fine a bit dated though shower had bad pressure .for the price though it was fine.the location was great close to shops etc but not the new area which was fine as that is just like a new city any where in the world.my only big complaint was we booked an executive room but the exec lounge was closed and were basically told to bad.as we paid extra for the lounge we were unimpressed after several talks with the manager they finally decided to refund the difference in price we paid but it was a strugle to get it!would stay there again but make sure you get what you paid for!
reviews.title: good and bad points

reviews.text: The hotel is a good 4 star choice in central Doha, within walking distance of the main sights & shopping. The hotel operates a shuttle bus to/from the airport at a small charge.
reviews.title: Good 4 star hotel in central Doha
over rated
reviews.text: The buffet restaurant food was good, the room spacious, clean and quiet, with good views.

This hotel tries to earn money and have a high rate of occupation - there are more and more transit passengers out of the bush from all over the world having no idea what civilisation is - maintenance od the hotel building is poor
reviews.title: Great Value Rooftop Restaurant

reviews.text: La Villa, the restaurant on the top floor offer good views of the city and a very interesting menu. It is great value for money compared to some of the big prices charged at other Doha hotels.
reviews.title: Good Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the mercure for three nights in July. I really have no complaints about the hotel. The beds were comfortable, the room clean, the air con was working and there was plenty of hot water.
reviews.title: A good enough hotel

reviews.text: True, the hotel has seen better days. The bathrooms are old fashioned (you have to climb into the bathtub to use the shower), the toilet paper is cheap and the two roll allowance is only just sufficient!
reviews.title: Stay some where else

reviews.text: However, the location is ideal being very close to the arab market and taxis are abundant. I suspect the whole area is due to be demolished in the next five years as Doha strives to be just as modern and vulgar as its neighbours in UAE.
reviews.title: Good hotel for shopping

reviews.text: The hotel restaurant is very good and there are plenty of other restaurants in the nearby arab market (only a 5 min walk away).
reviews.title: Ok, really

reviews.text: Good value for money by Doha standards, I would recommend the hotel to those only visiting the city for a few days.
reviews.title: Beware Of Infestations

likes.liked: — Hot water in the bathroom plentiful
likes.disliked: — The infestation which seemed to be a common occurance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Mercure in the beginning of August. As mentioned by others, the hotel is quite centrally located, near the souqs and Al Corniche. Not that you'd want to walk around a lot in the summer, but it's the thought that counts.
reviews.title: Good location, wonderful staff
All Good
reviews.text: Our room had a nice view over Doha, only too bad that it was a bit hazy in the afternoon (don't know whether that's usual) and all the amenities you would expect in a 4 star hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel staff were simply wonderful, very friendly and attentive. I would especially would like to mention the bell captain, who seems to be genuinely concerned about the well-being of his guests. After the chaotic scenes at Doha airport, arriving at the Mercure was a breath of fresh air.
reviews.title: An excellent 4* Hotel - value for money compared to other hotels in Doha

description: On the Persian Gulf and in the heart of the city, the hotel is located in the business district near the traditional Arab souk and the National Museum. 172 rooms and 3 suites. Non smoking floor. International cuisine at La Brasserie, Mediterranean cuisine at La Villa. The Old Manor Steakhouse and Bar. 3 meeting rooms for up to 200 people. Exhibition centre and golf course nearby. Airport shuttle (fees apply). Leisure facilities includes Swimming Pool and Fitness centre.
